Jason-Kyle De Lara

A full stack web developer


Jason-Kyle

Hello, I'm Jason-Kyle De Lara and I'm a full-stack developer based in Las Vegas, NV. I started my development journey in middle school learning HTML3 through a web design elective. In high school, I moved on to learning Java for two years and took the Computer Science AP Exam which followed an Introductory CS course from Central Connecticut State University (CS 151 Bradley Kjell). I wasn't too sure about my career path during high school as I did look into video game development, computer engineering, cinematography or computer science. Once I graduated High School, I entered the University of Nevada Las Vegas to focus on Computer Engineering. Later to find out that the field wasn't for me and that I actually missed programming, thus I switched my major to Computer Science. I learned many Object-Oreiented languages such as C++, Java, and C# however, the ciriculum only focused on aspects that I wasn't to interested in. I'm a creator and artist at heart. My whole life I've always been creative and took on many aspects of art as a hobby like photography, drawing, cinematography, digital design, etc. I wanted to design and create something visually appealing but my University's curriculum didn't have much of the sort. I learned a few things about video game development in a Computer Graphics course, but that was different from what I expected. I looked into many different pathways of computer science and I was very passionate about taking the path of web development, more specifically front end and once I have more experience under the belt a full stack developer.




Skills

Front End

Essential understanding of HTML, CSS and JavaScript for the front-end. With knowledge of frameworks like React and jQuery.

Back End

Great understanding of back end technologies like REST APIs, Ajax, NodeJS, PHP and frameworks like Express. Solid understanding of CRUD with database managment systems like SQL and MongoDB.

Deployment

Whether is a pure front end, pure back end or both, I have a good understanding of deploying a full scale website/application that is fully functional.

Technologies

I love learning and have acquired a vast arrray of technlogical skills from school and my own personal studies. I'd love to learn much more to see your company grow.

Projects

Here is a collection of my favorite projects.

Blackjack

Project was primarily done with Javascript and lacked reponsiveness throughout the application. Game is fully functional with rematch capabilities, score counter, hand count, and all Blackjack functionalities. Game is fair with every game starting with a newly shuffled deck. Currently remaking this game with ReactJS.

Github Try it out here!
OfflineTV Watcher

Project was an early React project. Website application lacks responsiveness right now but have future revisions to do however I'm primarily focusing on doing more React and Backend work. Application is fully functional. Users are able to watch any of the members streams by choosing who at the top. With the help of React, by choosing on a member the social links to the right of the stream are dynamically changing based on which member you're currently on. Due to no proper backend to the application the routing has trouble loading the application if it isn't launched in the main page.

Github Try it out here!
Quark

Quark is a particle engine/library that I helped create with a few collegues from college during our Senior Design class. We were tasked to create a particle engine with our professors Evidence based language Quorum. Basically everything from scratch except the objects used, we created a functional library with particle and particle emitter properites and a particle editor that creates and saves properties of a particle via JSON.

Bitbucket Video Demo
Materialize Portfolio

Primarily started learing Materialize as I was looking for CSS frameworks to learn and Bootstrap was starting to become obsolete. This Materialized Portfolio is just a remake of this current portfilio.

Github Try it out here!
Ghibili API App

An early project of mine to learn the use of APIs. With the used of the Studio Ghibli API, I created an app that lists all the movies and a quick description about them.

Github
Clock Day/Night App

A basic clock application I created when I started learning JavaScript. Based on the time of day, the wallpaper changes.

Github Check it here!
